properties.areaDesc: South Laramie Range Foothills; Central Laramie County; Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County
properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 5 at 7:53AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW LIKELY IN THE WIND PRONE AREAS OF
SOUTHEAST WYOMING THROUGH MID DAY THURSDAY...

...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ALONG INTERSTATE 80 WEST OF
LARAMIE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH HEAVY SNOW LIKELY
SPREADING INTO THE INTERSTATE 25 CORRIDOR...

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations in excess
of 6 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 35 mph.

* WHERE...Central Laramie County including the city of Cheyenne,
South Laramie Range Foothills and the Interstate 25 corridor
south of Wheatland.

* WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through late Friday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel may become dangerous due to icy, snow covered
roads and low visibility in falling and blowing snow.
properties.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT
